required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of MBG453 in Combination With Azacitidine and Venetoclax in AML Patients Unfit for Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Multi-center, Single Arm, Safety and Efficacy Study of MBG453 in Combination With Azacitidine and Venetoclax for the Treatment of Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) in Adult Patients Unfit for Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: This trial will seek to extend the preliminary findings of efficacy of MBG453 in combination with hypomethylating agents (HMA) by evaluating MBG453 in combination with the HMA azacitidine and the Bcl-2 inhibitor venetoclax. The primary purpose of Part 1 (Safety Run-in) is to rule out excessive toxicity of MBG453, when administered in combination with azacitidine and venetoclax. The primary purpose of the combined Part 1 and Part 2 (Safety run-in and Expansion Part) is to evaluate efficacy of MBG453, when administered in combination with azacitidine and venetoclax in adult patients with newly diagnosed AML, who are not suitable for treatment with intensive chemotherapy.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: safety -run -in with escalating dose of MBG453 followed by expansion

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of dose limiting toxicities (Safety run-in patients only)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Cycle 1 Day 8 to end of Cycle 2; Cycle =28 Days
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of tolerability of MBG in combination with venetoclax and azacitidine

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects achieving complete remission (CR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: at least 6 cycles from last patient first treatment up to 100 weeks (each cycle =28 Days)
primary_outcome.description: Assessing Complete Remission (CR) Rate (Safety run in (expansion dose Level only) + Expansion)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects achieving a complete remission (CR) or complete remission with incomplete hematologic blood count recovery (CRi)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 12 weeks (starting at week 5) for up to 48 months from last patient first treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing the durability of complete remission (CR) or complete remission with incomplete hematologic blood count recovery (CRi) rate by determining the relapse free survival (RFS) in participants who achieve complete response (CR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from date of first documented CR or CRi to the date of first documented relapse or death due to any cause
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 12 weeks (starting at week 5) for up to 48 months from last patient first treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Time to relapse from CR/CRi or death (relapse free survival), whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from the date of the first documented CR to the date of first documented relapse or death due to any cause
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 12 weeks (starting at week 5) for up to 48 months from last patient first treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing the durability of complete remission (CR) by determining the Relapse Free Survival (RFS) in subjects who achieved CR, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from start of treatment until death, relapse from CR, or treatment failure, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 12 weeks (starting at week 5) for up to 48 months from last patient first treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from start of treatment to death due to any cause (overall survival)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: date of start of treatment to date of death due to any reason (for up to 48 months from last patient first treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to death due to any cause to assess overall survival

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 8 (end of infusion) and Cycle 3 Day 8 (end of infusion), cycle = 28 days
Day 8 of Cycle 1,2,3,6,9,12,18, 24 and through treatment completion, an average of 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration of MBG453 prior to next dosing or after end of treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 8 of Cycle 1, 3 and 8 ; Cycle =28 days
secondary_outcome.description: Trough concentration of venetoclax on treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: prior to first dose of MGB453 on Cycle 1 Day 8 (cycle =28 Days)
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity to MBG453 prior to MBG453 exposure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study until 150 day safety follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity to MBG453 on Treatment and after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of MRD-negative subjects in the full study population and in subjects achieving CR or CRi
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 12 weeks (starting at week 5) for up to 48 months from last patient first treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of subjects who achieve transfusion independence from baseline and while on treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from start of treatment up to 48 months from last patient first treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects who are not dependent on blood transfusions for more than 8 weeks will be determined and related to the total number of patients participating to report percentage

arm_group.description: Patients will receive MBG453 in combination with Venetoclax and Azacitidine

intervention.description: Solution for subcutaneous injection or intravenous infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Signed informed consent must be obtained prior to participation in the study.
2. Age ≥ 18 years at the date of signing the informed consent form (ICF)
3. Newly diagnosed with AML based on 2016 WHO classification (Arber et al 2016) and not suitable for intensive chemotherapy defined as: age ≥75, ECOG performance Status 2 or 3, or any of the following comomorbitities: severe cardiac comorbities (including congestive heart failure, LVEF ≤ 50%, chronic stable Angina) , pulmonary comorbidity (DLCO ≤ 65% or FEVI ≤ 65%). moderate hepatic impairment (with total Bilirubin >1.5 to 3x ULN) , renal impairment (eGFR≥ 30 ml/min/1.73m^2 to 45 30 ml/min/1.73m^2), or other comorbidity incompatible with intensive chemotherapy per Investigator assessement and approved by the Novartis Medical monitor)
4. .Not planned for hematopoietic stem-cell transplantation (HSCT)
5. .Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0, 1 , 2 or 3
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior exposure to TIM-3 directed therapy
2. Subjects with therapy related AML.
3. History of severe hypersensitivity reactions to any ingredient of study drug(s) (azacitidine, venetoclax or MGB453) or monoclonal antibodies (mAbs) and/or their excipients
4. Current use or use within 14 days prior to randomization of systemic, steroid therapy (> 10 mg/day prednisone or equivalent) or any immunosuppressive therapy. Topical, inhaled, nasal, ophthalmic steroids are allowed. Replacement therapy, steroids given in the context of a transfusion are allowed and not considered a form of systemic treatment.
5. Previous treatment at any time, with any of the following antineoplastic agents, approved or investigational; checkpoint inhibitors, venetoclax and hypomethylating agents (HMAs) such as decitabine or azacitidine.
6. Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic therapy (e.g.corticosteroids).
7. Live vaccine administered within 30 Days prior to randomization
Other protocol-defined Inclusion/Exclusion may apply.

facility.name: Memorial Sloan Kettering Dept. of MSKCC

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent expert panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data is currently available according to the process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com.
